Gliese 581c is a confirmed exoplanet that orbits within the habitable zone of its star. It is one of the first Earth-sized exoplanets to be discovered. Alpha Centauri is the closest star system to Earth, located about 4.37 light-years away. It is a triple star system, consisting of two Sun-like stars (Alpha Centauri A and Alpha Centauri B) and a red dwarf star (Proxima Centauri). Proxima b is a confirmed exoplanet that orbits within the habitable zone of Proxima Centauri. It is the closest known exoplanet to Earth.

TRAPPIST-1 is a star system located about 39 light-years from Earth. It is the first known star system to have seven Earth-sized planets orbiting within its habitable zone. The planets are all very close to each other, and they are thought to be tidally locked to their star, meaning that the same side of each planet always faces the star.
